page.title: 08THE POPULATION OF ALFRISTON
page.content: Alfriston has a population of 807, many of whom have come to live in Alfriston on retirement. It has a Parish Council, non-political, of 8 members elected every 3 years who make recommendations to the Wealden District Council which administers the area. They are in the Lewes Parliamentary constituency. There is no resident policeman. The area to the west of the High St. is residential. There is a garage for servicing cars. The Primary School is in North Road and next to it is the playing field which belongs to the Parish Council. Also in North Road is the Doctor's Surgery and an Abbeyfield Sheltered Home for the elderly is being built. Any new building in Alfriston is infilling for which planning permission has to be sought. Council houses were erected in the 1930s.
